etymology.description: 纯(純) ‘pure’ + 素 ‘plain; vegetarian’ = strictly plant-based (vegan).
etymology.interpretation: Emphasizes complete avoidance of animal products, stronger than 素/素食 which may include eggs or dairy. Common in compounds like 纯素饮食 and 纯素者; also corresponds to 全素 in Taiwan usage.
etymology.simplification: 纯 was simplified from 純 by replacing the silk radical 糸 with 纟 in the PRC script reform; phonetic 屯 retained. 素 is unchanged.

examples.chinese: 他坚持纯素饮食(他堅持純素飲食)。
examples.english: He sticks to a vegan diet.

examples.chinese: 这家餐厅提供纯素选项(這家餐廳提供純素選項)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā cāntīng tígōng chúnsù xuǎnxiàng.
